task: Audit synesthetic-schemas repository for contextual and technical debt
objective: Identify technical and contextual debt in the schemas repo that could compromise determinism, clarity, or long-term maintainability. Focus on schema integrity, governance drift, redundant scripts, and doc-spec misalignment.

definitions.Technical Debt: Structural or automation-level fragility, redundancy, or lack of determinism increasing maintenance cost.
definitions.Contextual Debt: Loss of clarity or rationale due to outdated documentation, implicit assumptions, or missing linkage between spec and implementation.
definitions.Lifecycle Class: Preventable (minor hygiene), Recoverable (requires refactor), Structural (deep design debt or dependency).

rules: Each finding must specify type (Technical/Contextual), lifecycle class, path, line range, and severity (High/Medium/Low).
Group findings by subsystem: Build, Schemas, Validation, Docs, Governance, CI.
Skip conceptual or reflective docs under docs/concepts/ and docs/notes/.
Audit for duplicate version strings, hardcoded canonical URLs, and missing frontmatter consistency.
Flag orphaned scripts or overlapping validation targets.
Check Makefile and CI logic for redundant normalization/publish stages.

exit_criteria: All findings categorized as Contextual, Technical, or Mixed
At least three Preventable or Recoverable items identified with clear remediation path
Cross-repo drift check complete (MCP alignment confirmed)
